title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
Please note that we are *not* currently accepting resumes or additional support from talent agencies or third-oparty sources. Any resumes received from these sources will be considered unsolicited.


We value integrity and clear communication with our partners, and appreciate your understanding in this matter.

**The role, at a glance:**  

We are seeking a Product Verification Engineer to evaluate software, firmware, associated with
  

electronic devices to ensure exceptional product quality. This role involves comprehensive
  

testing and validation of applications and associated audio/visual and room control equipment to
  

meet rigorous quality standards.  



  

**How you'll contribute:**

* Design, develop, and execute comprehensive test plans for software, firmware, associated
  

with electronic devices
* Perform manual and automated testing including black box testing on desktop devices,
  

networked systems, and cloud-connected devices
* Develop and maintain automated test scripts using programming languages such as C, C++,
  

C#, Python, or similar tools
* Configure and manage network environments for testing both locally and in cloud
  

environments
* Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including development, quality assurance,
  

and product management
* Analyze test results, identify defects, and work with development teams to resolve issues
* Document test plans, test cases, and results using tools such as Jira
* Review technical specifications and provide constructive feedback
* Support continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
* Other duties as assigned

  

**A successful candidate should have:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical
  

Engineering, Electronics Engineering Technology, or equivalent combination of education and
  

experience
* Minimum 6 years of hands-on testing experience with knowledge of diverse testing
  

methodologies and protocols
* Demonstrated experience in product verification and validation processes
* Demonstrated experience with test automation tools
* Proficiency in programming languages: C, C++, C#, Python, or similar languages
* Experience with multiple operating systems: Windows, Linux, Android, iOS
* Strong understanding of network protocols and cloud technologies
* Experience with test management tools (Jira preferred)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to create detailed technical documentation including test plans and quality reports
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities

 **Some nice-to-haves:**

* Experience with Dart and Flutter
* Experience with automation frameworks and tools such as pytest, Selenium, Test Complete,
  

Playwright, Postman, or other API testing tools • Knowledge of audio/visual equipment testing
* Experience with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes
* Familiarity with industry standards and compliance requirements

 **Work Environment:**

* Office environment with occasional lab testing
* Ability to lift to 15 kg
* On-site presence required

**Who is Biamp?**


We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.


As we grow to meet our customers’ needs and evolve to address the challenges of tomorrow, one guiding principle remains the same: Biamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences.

**About our company:**


At Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decisions even when they don’t succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.

title: AI & Data Engineering Manager
description:
*Are you ready to take lead in the AI & data transformation at Saab?*


Your Role


The need for advanced AI & data solutions in defense has never been higher than right now. The ability to harness AI & data is no longer just a technical advantage, it is a strategic necessity. Saab is looking for a visionary AI & Data Engineering Manager to join our newly established organization. This is a high-impact leadership role where you will translate deep technical expertise into mission-critical solutions that safeguard people and society.


You will bridge the gap between cutting-edge innovation and operational reality, collaborate across Saab’s core Business Areas to ensure our AI and data platforms power the next generation of defense technology. This includes advanced aerial platforms like the Gripen fighter system, integrating intelligent capabilities into ground combat systems, enhancing sensor performance and electronic warfare, and the future of advanced submarines and surface vessels.


We are looking for a visionary, collaborative, and technically grounded leader who thrives on converting complexity into value. Your mission is to scale future AI use cases while evolving the secure, mission-critical platforms that sustain them.


Key Responsibilities

* Strategic Leadership: Lead and develop a high-performing, cross-functional team of AI and data professionals. Foster a culture of excellence, continuous learning, and innovation.
* Platform Excellence: Own the roadmap for scalable, secure, and user-centric AI & Data platforms. Ensure reliability and performance while balancing technical rigor with agile execution.
* Organizational Catalyst: Act as a key driver of AI adoption across the enterprise, aligning architecture and solutions with the mission-critical needs of our various business units.
* Responsible AI: Champion ethical AI practices, ensuring fairness, transparency, and explainability are baked into the core of our technical foundations.
* Governance & Security: Maintain strict adherence to security protocols, data governance, and compliance, critical for our role in national defense.


Your Profile


Required Qualifications

* Proven leadership experience within AI, data platforms, data science, or enterprise architecture, with a demonstrated ability to inspire and develop teams.
* Strong technical foundation across the AI & data lifecycle, including platforms, infrastructure, experimentation, and deployment.
* Extensive experience working closely with business stakeholders to translate complex needs into scalable, high-impact technical solutions.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, combined with a proactive, collaborative, and positive leadership style.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering).
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.


Preferred Experience

* Experience building or scaling highly scalable AI/ML platforms, data mesh architectures, or cloud-based AI environments.
* Familiarity with MLOps, model lifecycle management, advanced data governance frameworks, and responsible AI practices.
* Solid understanding of hybrid cloud environments, platform security, and compliance best practices.
* Experience with product thinking and a strong focus on end-user and developer experience.


This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.


What you will be part of


Explore a wealth of possibilities. Take on challenges, create smart inventions, and grow beyond. This is a place for curious minds, brave pioneers, and everyone in between. Together, we achieve the extraordinary, each bringing our unique perspectives. Your part matters.


Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 26,100 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.


Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here


Join us in keeping people and society safe. Apply today.


Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: QA Lead - Göteborg
description:
***Välkommen till MRC Bemanning– bemanning och konsultlösningar för framtiden***


Vi är ett bemannings- och konsultföretag som arbetar brett över flera branscher. Vår drivkraft är att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt uppdrag, oavsett om det handlar om teknik, administration, ekonomi, logistik eller andra områden.

***Vad vi gör***


Vi hjälper företag och organisationer att hitta den kompetens de behöver för att växa – samtidigt som vi erbjuder våra konsulter spännande uppdrag som utvecklar både karriären och individen. Hos oss kan du arbeta i olika roller och branscher, allt beroende på din erfarenhet och vad du själv vill satsa på framåt.

***Vår kultur***


Hos oss är du aldrig ”bara” en konsult. Du blir en del av ett nätverk där vi stöttar varandra, utvecklas tillsammans och där din personliga resa är minst lika viktig som din yrkesroll. Vi tror på öppenhet, gemenskap och att bygga långsiktiga relationer – både med kunder och medarbetare.

***Varför välja oss?***

* Trygga anställningar med kollektivavtal
* Uppdrag i flera olika branscher – du väljer vägen framåt
* Möjlighet till kompetensutveckling och nya karriärvägar
* Ett personligt bemötande – vi ser dig och dina mål

  

Vi på **MRC Bemanning** letar efter passionerade IT-konsulter som vill vara med och göra skillnad – både för våra kunder och för varandra.

***Vad du kommer att göra***


Som IT-konsult hos oss får du arbeta med uppdrag som matchar just din kompetens och dina intressen. Det kan handla om:

* Systemutveckling och programmering
* Cloud-lösningar (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud)
* IT-säkerhet och infrastruktur
* Projektledning och kravställning


Det viktiga för oss är inte exakt vad du gjort tidigare, utan vart du vill utvecklas framåt.

***Vem vi söker***


Vi letar efter dig som älskar IT och vill använda din kunskap för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Du gillar problemlösning, är nyfiken på ny teknik och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Vi tror att du har några års erfarenhet inom IT, men det viktigaste är din passion, ditt driv och viljan att växa i konsultrollen.


Rollens omfattning:

* Driva uppföljning av åtgärder och kvalitetsförbättringar, dokumenterade i ServiceNow
* Koordinera och underlätta rotorsaksanalys (RCA) för incidenter relaterade till kärntjänster
* Spåra och följa upp fel med hjälp av JIRA
* Stödja Scrum Masters och team med acceptanskriterier och definition av färdigt resultat


Profil:

* Starka kommunikations- och faciliteringsfärdigheter
* Bekväm med att arbeta med oklara gränser och förändrade prioriteringar
* Erfarenhet av kvalitetssäkring, problemkoordinering eller liknande tvärfunktionella roller
* Bekanta med agila miljöer

***Vad du får hos oss***

* Spännande och varierande uppdrag hos intressanta kunder
* En arbetsplats med högt i tak, öppen kommunikation och härliga kollegor
* Lön som speglar din erfarenhet

  

Har du frågor? Hör av dig till **Fredrik Steveling** på mail, **fredrik.steveling@mrcbemanning.se** – vi berättar gärna mer om rollen och oss som arbetsgivare.

title: Senior Business Controller
description:
Vi på Iver brinner för innovationer och god laganda, vi är särskilt intresserad av dig som gillar att tänka nytt och dela med dig av dina tankar. Vi söker en Senior Business Controller som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss! Är du vår nya kollega? We empower our Nordic society Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 300 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden. Din roll på Iver Vi söker en ytterligare en kollega till controller-teamet som befinner sig i en spännande fas där roller, ansvar, processer och verktyg är under utveckling. Group Business Control-team som utgörs av en diversifierad grupp av medarbetare som leds av Head of FP&A. Detta är en analytisk och affärsnära roll där du tillsammans med teamet kommer att ansvara för flera affärsområden och samarbeta med såväl affärsledningsgrupperna och företagsledningen. I rollen kommer du att agera Business Partner och vara en rådgivande part kopplat till insikter och beslut som ska fattas. Du har möjlighet att tillsammans med Head of FP&A utforma rollen. Arbetsuppgifter:
  
  

Samarbeta med olika avdelningar för att säkerställa korrekt och relevant finansiell rapportering, samt identifiera utvecklingsområden.
  
  

Stödja verksamheten med strategisk planering och beslutsfattande genom att tillhandahålla insiktsfulla finansiella analyser och rekommendationer.
  
  

Stötta affärsområden och ledningsgrupp med löpande rapportering, uppföljning och ad-hoc analyser.
  
  

Analysera finansiella data och identifiera trender, risker och möjligheter.
  
  

Utveckla, implementera och underhålla finansiella modeller och prognosverktyg för att stödja datadrivna affärsbeslut.
  
  

Delta i utvecklingen av nyckeltal, rapportering och affärssystem med hjälp av befintliga och nya verktyg och modeller.
  
  

Självständigt leda och koordinera arbetsströmmar inom utvecklingsprojekt. Vad erbjuder vi dig? På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser för att vi ska utvecklas. Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för "The Iver way". Förmåner hos oss: Kollektivavtal & trygga villkor Hybridarbete Friskvårdsbidrag Terminalglasögon ⏳ Tidsbank – 24 h extra ledighet/år Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring Tjänstepension (ITP) & flexpension Vem söker vi? För att passa i rollen ser vi att du har en bakgrund inom Transaction Services. Du trivs i en föränderlig miljö och kan arbeta självständigt inom ramen för ett team. Du är en proaktiv problemlösare med starka analytiska färdigheter, som inte bara kan identifiera trender och risker utan också omvandla och kommunicera dessa insikter till strategiska rekommendationer. Som Business Controller i vårt team kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva och stödja finansiella projekt och beslut. Du är självgående och bekväm med att ta initiativ, och du har förmågan att kommunicera komplex finansiell information på ett lättförståeligt sätt till olika intressenter. Vi värdesätter din förmåga att samarbeta tvärfunktionellt, nyfikenhet att ta till sig och skapa best practice för att utveckla dig själv och Iver. Vi ser även att du:
  
  

Är självgående och proaktiv med förmåga att driva projekt och leverera resultat inom utsatta tidsramar.
  
  

Har Civilekonomexamen eller motsvarande.
  
  

Har starka analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att hantera stora datamängder.
  
  

Utmärkta kunskaper i Excel.
  
  

Har erfarenhet av Power-BI eller motsvarande Business Intelligence system.
  
  

Meriterande med erfarenhet av Transaction Services (FDD, CDD, Valuation, Corporate finance).
  
  

Har god kommunikativ förmåga och vana att presentera komplexa finansiella data på ett begripligt sätt.
  
  

Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift. Placeringsort: Iver finns på 25 orter i Norden. Denna roll utgår från vårt huvudkontor i Solna. Övrig information: Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet, därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser. Sök till oss! Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2026-02-05. Välkommen att kontakta TA Partner Linnea Blomgren linnea.blomgren@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Diagnostic and Troubleshooting Method Engineer
description:
Diagnostic and Troubleshooting Method Engineer


TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com.  

  

Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.**Role Summary**

Are you a curious engineer with a strong interest in programming and vehicles? Then you might be the one we are looking for! We are expanding one of our teams; TGROSVM – E-Mobility Diagnostics (Vehicle Service Information).  

  

We are looking for someone who is service-oriented and enjoys combining theory, practice, and problem-solving. As a Method Engineer, you will be responsible for diagnostic and troubleshooting support for TRATON’s products, with a primary focus in one or more areas within electrified vehicles.  

Your role involves developing diagnostic and troubleshooting support in close collaboration with system and function owners. As a diagnostic method engineer, you are the voice of the mechanics in development projects, and your deliveries have a direct impact on their daily work, which is crucial for the profitability of both TRATON and our customers.  

  

Our new cloud-based troubleshooting tool, Scania Workshop Suite, presents great opportunities to work with system developers to improve the mechanics’ daily work. You will help take troubleshooting support on this new platform to the next level!**Job Responsibilities**

The main job responsibilities for this role is to;
* Develop diagnostic and troubleshooting methods/support, implement and test them on rigs and in vehicles.
* You are the voice of the mechanics in development project and will contribute with requirements and important input during all of the project phases.
* You will also contribute with valuable input to our internal software development teams, based on customer- and project needs.
**Who You Are**

To succeed in this role, you need to be driven, curious, proactive, and quality-conscious. Since the role involves many interfaces, you should be good at networking and building relationships, be attentive, and understand what is important to the customer. You are structured and good at prioritizing and planning your work. We hire for attitude and train for competence!
* Minimum category B driver’s license
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken
* Strong interest in or curiosity about programming

  



We also believe you have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechatronics, mechanical engineering, or a similar field, or experience working with system development, vehicle systems, or programming. Since we are working with mainly electrified vehicles, it is meriting to have competence within the area of electrical engineering and/or electric vehicles.

We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.**This Is Us**

Our section consists of 20+ driven and competent method engineers, technical writers and a product coordinator divided in three groups within following diagnostics areas:  

E-Mobility / Chassis, Cab and Body / Powertrain. We have a close collaboration within the section and help and learn from each other in our daily work.

It is important for us to have an open climate where everyone feels that they can be themselves – and we also know the importance of having fun during the workdays; because we all know that “a good laugh prolongs life”.

Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry.**TRATON Offers**

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses for an easy commute to Södertälje.**Application**

We look forward to receiving your application, consisting of your CV and kindly ask you not to share a cover letter to ensure an efficient and unbiased recruitment process for all parties.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2026-01-18. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:  

Sofia Wahling, Unit manager, sofia.wahling@scania.com  

  

**We look forward to your application!**  

  

***This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON Group R&D***  

  

***#LI-hybrid***

title: Event Manager, Nordics
description:
Pax8 is picking up serious momentum in the Nordics. We’re looking for an experienced Event Manager to design, own, and elevate our events strategy across Sweden, Finland, Norway and Denmark. Your mission will be to craft unforgettable experiences that bring partners together, spark conversations, and drive real commercial impact.


From flagship industry moments to intimate, high-value partner masterclasses, you’ll lead a dynamic portfolio of events end to end. Working shoulder-to-shoulder with sales and regional leaders, you’ll turn bold ideas into flawlessly executed experiences that fuel pipeline, strengthen community, and position Pax8 as a market leader.


If you’re a hands-on event pro who thrives on pace, knows how to turn creativity into measurable ROI, and wants to leave a visible mark in a high-growth market, this is your chance to build something meaningful from the ground up, at a defining moment for Pax8 in Sweden, across the Nordics, and beyond.
 

**What you’ll be doing day-to-day**

️ **Lead and deliver a calendar of strategic events** across the Nordics, including Pax8-owned events, industry showcases, masterclasses, and community meetups.
 

**Collaborate with sales, marketing, and senior stakeholders** to ensure every event drives commercial impact, generating leads, signing, activating, and upselling partners.
 

**Bring fresh ideas and creativity** to the table, optimising event experiences, exploring new formats, and leveraging strategic partnerships (especially with Microsoft and other vendors).
 

**Own the end-to-end event process** : from planning and budgeting, to execution, hosting, and post-event analysis.
 

**Track and report on ROI** for every event, using data to inform future recommendations and drive continuous improvement.
‍‍ 

**Mentor and support colleagues** (including more junior team members), sharing best practice and helping to build a collaborative, high-performing team.
 

**Travel across the Nordics and occasionally EMEA/UK** to deliver events and build community.
 

**Embrace technology and AI** —using tools like Cvent, Salesforce, Power BI, and Microsoft Office, and exploring how AI can enhance event planning and execution.


**Sounds like you?**

* **Experienced event professional** - with significant experience in event management
* **Channel and digital know-how** - comfortable with channel marketing, digital campaigns, and maximising event ROI.
* **Self-starter who thrives in ambiguity** - able to navigate uncertainty, take ownership, and hit the ground running.
* **People person** - loves building relationships, collaborating with diverse stakeholders, and representing Pax8 out in the field.
* **Data-driven and detail-oriented** - skilled at tracking metrics (MQLs, cost per MQL), analysing results, and making evidence-based decisions.
* **Agile and flexible** - embraces change, adapts quickly, and uses downtime to learn, improve, and add value.
* **Excellent communicator** - fluent in English and Swedish (other Nordic languages a bonus), with strong written and verbal skills.
* **Tech-savvy** - proficient with Microsoft Office, Cvent, Salesforce, Power BI, and open to using AI in day-to-day work.
* **Willing to travel** - across the Nordics and occasionally further afield for events and team collaboration.

To fulfil this role, you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.


**About Pax8**

Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support, giving our Partners for the first time a real choice. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.


Our servant leaders put employees first and we are about delivering exceptional employee experience to inspire customer experience.


We are Pax8 where our employee experience meets customer experience - come and be "work happy" with us!


**Our Journey from the US to EMEA:** https://www.pax8.com/blog/office-opening-bristol/


**Learn more about our journey and achievements by checking out these articles:**

* **Exciting Times at Pax8- meet our new CEO** **-** https://www.business-live.co.uk/technology/cloud-software-company-pax8-appoints-29101153
* **Pax8 recognised as Microsoft Partner of the year 2024 -** https://www.pax8.com/en-us/news-post/pax8-recognized-as-the-winner-of-2024-microsoft-global-partner-of-the-year/
* **Pax8 unveils next Generation Marketplace Experience -** https://www.pax8.com/en-us/news-post/pax8-unveils-next-generation-marketplace-experience/
* **Scott Chasin:** Exciting Times - meet our new CEO
* **Pax8 Nordic Expansion :** https://www.pax8.com/en-uk/news-post/pax8-emea-drives-northern-europe-expansion-with-new-regional-sales-director-appointment/

We win awards for our people's hard work and the positive experiences they have while doing it. For that reason, we are proud to have just been certified as a **'Great Place to Work'** .


**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We cultivate an environment where we value and encourage a diverse range of perspectives.**

We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!


**Pax8 Stockholm Office Environment**

* Starting salary between 36,250 to 45,000 SEK monthly gross (depending on experience)
* Energetic WeWork Office in the city centre of Stockholm
* Regular social and community events
* Naturally light offices for wellbeing at work
* Dedicated desks and breakout areas with laptop dock and monitors

If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries, you can ring the talent partner managing this role, Dan, on +44 117 457 8923 (No Agencies Please)


**What’s in it for you?**

Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are growth minded and curious, there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 37%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & LinkedIn Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level.


**Why Pax8?**

Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.


As part of our hiring process, we are required to undertake pre-employment checks on all candidates that are successful in their application with Pax8. As part of these checks Pax8 will request ID verification, reference requests and qualification checks (additional checks will be completed for UK candidates only, such as criminal and financial). All checks are completed by our third-party provider, Vero.


Once checks have been completed all candidates will receive a copy for their records.


**Equal Opportunities**

Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the UK. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.


Job Applicant Privacy Notice ( https://www.pax8.com/en-us/terms/job-applicant-privacy-notice/ )

title: HR & Recruitment Specialist
description:
**About TP-Link**

*TP-Link is a global leader in network products and advanced connectivity solutions, ranked as the world’s NO.1supplier of WLAN products. With operations in over 170 countries, TP-Link Nordic maintains an active presence across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland and Iceland, with its Swedish office established in 2013. Our portfolio includes intelligent mesh and smart home eco-systems, cloud-managed surveillance solutions, high-performance enterprise SDN networking, and ISP solutions. Through innovation, dedication, and strategic partnerships, we contribute to regional growth and customer success.*

**About the Role**  
As an HR & Recruitment Specialist, you will take on a hands-on role with a strong emphasis on recruitment while gradually expanding your scope within broader HR areas. Supporting Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland, you will work closely with the Nordic HR Manager and hiring managers to attract, engage, and hire talent across Sales, Technical, and selected corporate functions.

This role is ideal for someone who is highly comfortable driving end-to-end recruitment, proactive search, and candidate outreach and who is motivated to grow into a broader HR role. You will play a key part in building strong pipelines, ensuring high-quality hiring, and contributing to HR initiatives that support business growth in a fast-moving Nordic organization.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Drive end-to-end recruitment for Sales, Technical, and other selected roles across the Nordics.
* Proactively screen CV:s, search, and engage candidates using multiple channels and creative outreach approaches.
* Partner closely with hiring managers to understand needs, advise on profiles, and ensure an efficient recruitment process.
* Contribute to employer branding initiatives, helping shape how people experience our company internally and externally.
* Provide guidance on HR policies, employment law, and best practices across the Nordic region.
* Support broader HR activities such as onboarding, employee relations and HR processes in close collaboration with the Nordic HR Manager and HR team.

**Desired Skills and Experience**

* Minimum 3–5 years of experience in Talent acquisition/Recruitment, preferably in IT, ICT, or consumer electronics environments.
* Enthusiastic about employer branding and enhancing the candidate experience, with a creative mindset to improve HR processes.
* Background in HR is a plus, or have a clear ambition to broaden skills within general HR over time.
* Up to date knowledge of good practice and emerging trends in the field of Recruitment and HR.
* Exposure to HR policies, employment law, and HR best practices across the Nordic region is a strong advantage.
* Professional fluency in both Swedish and English.

**What We Offer**

* Personal and professional growth: Learn across most HR domains with mentoring and support from colleagues.
* Collaborative Nordic team: Work closely with motivated colleagues across Sweden, Norway, Denmark, and Finland.
* Flexible working arrangements: Mix of office and remote work to suit your lifestyle.
* Fun and supportive culture: Enjoy a positive, energetic environment where your contributions are valued.

**Additional Information**

* Location: Hybrid (remote and office-based at Gustav III:s Boulevard 54, 169 74 Solna).
* Start date: Preferable during Q1 2026.

*If you enjoy recruitment and want to grow within HR in a Nordic, fast-moving environment we would love to hear from you!*

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Lön: Från 45 000,00kr per månad

Förmåner:

* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Jobba hemifrån
* Personalrabatt
* Tjänstepension

Ansökningsfrågor:

* Do you have hands-on experience driving end-to-end recruitment, including proactive sourcing/search (e.g. LinkedIn Recruiter, Boolean search, direct outreach to passive candidates)?

Erfarenhet:

* Recruitment: 3 år (Obligatoriskt)

Språk:

* Engelska (Obligatoriskt)
* Svenska (Obligatoriskt)

Arbetsort: Delvis på distans i 169 74 Solna

title: H&M Summer Internship - Data Engineering
description:
**Job Description**  

Curious about what it’s like to see the world of Data Engineering at H&M? Are you eager to get hands-on experience and turn your theoretical knowledge into practical skills. If you are intrigued by how the world’s largest fashion brand operates, then this opportunity is for you! Level up your learning journey and gain those essential skills that will benefit


As a Data Engineering Intern at H&M, you will get the opportunity to spend 11 weeks learning about our business and different functions while getting real-life experience working on current projects. Additionally, it’s a great networking opportunity to collaborate with colleagues across the company and connect with interns from other programs to explore the versatility of our business.


During the internship, you will get to work next to the AI, Analytics, & Data Tech Center who will play a key role in developing your skills and offer different training opportunities. You will have a network of support from experienced colleagues that will be on hand to help you learn.

***This is your chance to launch a stellar career and help us transform the fashion world. Let’s shape the future together!***

 **What you’ll be doing:**


As a Data Engineering Intern, your experience will be a mix of hands-on development work, mentorship, and structured learning opportunities. You will:

* Contribute to real projects – Help develop and optimize complex AI & data pipelines, ensuring smooth data flow across multiple domains
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams – Work with engineers, data scientists, and designers to build innovative tech products
* Learn from experienced Data engineers – Participate in code reviews, troubleshooting, and debugging sessions
* Gain exposure to modern development tools – Work with agile methodologies, cloud platforms, and industry-standard tools
* Explore new technologies – Stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in Data & AI engineering

**What you’ll be learning:**


Throughout the internship, you’ll be given opportunities to:

* Gain hands-on experience working with multi - cloud environment (,such(, such as GCP), and improve your coding skills (we work with programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, Go/Golang, YAML, Java)
* Develop problem-solving skills through real-world challenges and collaboration with your team
* Learn internal tools and best practices, including version control (Git), CI/CD pipelines, automating and streamlining the software development lifecycle
* Receive structured learning opportunities, including relevant training sessions on modern software engineering practices and industry tools
* Enhance your professional development with mentorship and career-building guidance from experienced tech leaders

 **Qualifications**  

To be successful in the role of Data Engineering Intern, we believe that you...

* Are currently enrolled in a university program (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, or related field) in the later stages of your academic career and will have coursework remaining after completing this internship (preferably fourth-year university students))
* Have basic knowledge of software development principles, algorithms, and data structures
* Have experience with one or more programming languages (Java, SQL, Python, JavaScript, etc.)
* Are familiar with version control systems (Git, GitHub)
* A curious problem-solver eager to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment
* Are fluent in English, both written and verbal and with excellent communication skills

 **Additional Information**  

This is a **full-time internship** located at our Head Office in Stockholm. We are looking for someone to start from 9th June for 11 weeks until 21st August.

**Good to know – Application & Practical Information**


Excited to join us? Then please get in touch. The last day to apply is 31st January. Due to GDPR, we can only handle applications via our career site. Send us your application in English including a resume and proof of education.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in to your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Benefits**


This is a paid internship program, meaning you will work full-time and receive a market-based salary. Other H&M Group benefits will be shared later in the process. You don’t have to live in Sweden already, we welcome applications from all parts of the world and offer relocation support if needed.

**Recruitment Process & Timeline**


When you apply for the **Data Engineering internship role,** we will have the following steps in the process:

**Screening questions:** When you apply, you will be asked to answer a few short questions to assess your eligibility for the role.

**Virtual Assessment Center:** If successful, you will be invited to a one-day assessment center, taking place between February 16th and March 3rd, including a behavioral interview and a case & competence interview. Details and preparations will be shared in advance.

**Final decision:** Our goal is to be able to let you know the outcome of the assessment center before March 13th.

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organizsation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience, and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible, and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence, all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
**About eghed** 




 eghed is an expertise group passionate about creating the AI solutions of the future. We are an innovative team with a strong passion for technology and an entrepreneurial spirit that permeates everything we do. Through close collaborations with our partners, both on-site and in-house, we develop solutions that not only meet today’s needs but also open doors to tomorrow’s possibilities. We have already developed proprietary IP that accelerates our deliveries, and we are constantly seeking new ways to push the boundaries of what is possible.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who shares our passion for creating something new and has the courage to explore uncharted territories. Here at eghed, you’ll have the opportunity to help build the company from the ground up, shape our technical solutions, and be a key player in our continued growth. We love individuals who are accustomed to solving complex problems and who thrive in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities May Include** 



* Leverages data to solve complex problems, extract meaningful insights, and inform decision-making processes within an organization.
* Work at the intersection of statistics, programming, and business, using tools like machine learning, data mining, and predictive modeling to analyze large datasets.
* Gather, clean, and process data, developing and training algorithms, and present findings in a way that is understandable and actionable for stakeholders.
* Helps both us and our partners to optimize processes, identify trends, and develop data-driven strategies for growth and innovation.



  





**Requirements** 



* At least 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist.
* A university degree in a highly technical and quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Physics, computer Science etc.)
* Proven experience in developing classification models using machine learning techniques.
* Hands-on experience with at least a couple of production-level data science projects - from prototyping to deployment and ongoing improvements.
* Proficiency with Python, SQL, and Git, along with solid experience of cloud computing. In-depth knowledge of machine learning frameworks, like Keras or PyTorch.
* Strong understanding of the theoretical foundations behind both classical and modern machine learning models and algorithms, such as generalized linear models, random forests, ensemble methods, and deep neural networks.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, both technical and non-technical. Strong skills in communication, organization, and teamwork, combined with solid business acumen.



  





**Why eghed?** 




 At eghed, you won’t just get a job – you’ll get an opportunity to join a journey where you can make an impact and create real change. We are a team that values innovation, collaboration, and a healthy dose of fresh thinking. Here, you’ll have the space to grow both professionally and personally, and we look forward to hearing your ideas and visions for the future.

title: GCP Solution Architect
description:
The Google Cloud Solution Architect is a key member of the Presales Solutions team responsible for providing business leadership and strategic technical direction for customers.
 



  





 · Relationship Management: Work to build and maintain broad relationships internally and externally within Google Cloud, coach and guide TEKsystems Global Services Sales, Practice & Delivery on strategy and Google Cloud solutions, and advise a team of extended partners throughout the sales process.
 



 · Solution Driver: Serve as the primary driver for identifying, scoping, and creating solutions/proposals that encompass technical approach, best practice, implementation, team structure, pricing, and contracts.
 



 · Advocacy: Work with appropriate TEKsystems Global Services and Google Cloud partners (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Partners, Google Cloud Consulting) to support customer interests, balancing that with the business needs of TEKsystems.
 



 · Strategic Thinking: Demonstrate the ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of global businesses and their financial implications.
 



 · Modernization Focus: Apply deep understanding of digital transformation—converting complex legacy IT environments to new native digital environments—focusing on Data Modernisation and AI/ML to solve enterprise IT challenges.
 



 · Thought Leadership: Act as a subject matter expert (SME) and deliver technical webinars, speak at public events, and present internally with cross-functional teams.
 



  





 Qualifications and Experience
 



 Education & Professional Background
 



 · Education: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, or related field.
 



 · Experience: Minimum 8+ years’ experience in Information Technology and/or Professional Services required; 12+ years preferred.
 



 · Presales: 5+ years in client-facing Presales/Solution Architect role interfacing with business and technology executives.
 



 · Professional Services: Minimum 5+ years’ hands-on experience in a professional services organization.
 



  





 Technical Expertise
 



 · Cloud Platforms: Minimum 5+ years’ hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and architecture models.
 



 · Data Architecture: Proven experience in designing and deploying data solutions and data architectures on Google Cloud, with hands-on expertise in services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Functions, and Pub/Sub.
 



 · AI & GenAI: Desirable experience with AI/Gen AI/ML services (e.g., Vertex AI, Gemini, Dialogflow CX, Natural Language API, Speech-to-Text).
 



 · Pipelines: Experience with architecting and implementing data pipelines, data lakes, and data warehousing solutions optimised for GenAI workloads.
 



 · Data Skills: Strong knowledge of data modelling, ETL processes, SQL, and scripting languages such as Python.
 



 · Big Data & Viz: Experience with Big Data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark/Dataproc) and data visualisation tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI).
 



 · Frameworks: Familiarity with AI/ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, etc.).
 



 · Security & Governance: Experience in implementing security standards and data governance policies within Google Cloud environments, including encryption, IAM, and Cloud Monitoring.
 



 · DevOps: Understanding of MLOps and DevOps practices and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, Google Cloud Deployment Manager).
 



 Certifications & Methodology
 



 · Certifications: Valid Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud Architect or Professional Data Engineer certification preferred.
 



 · Technical Leadership: Guide development teams in adopting best practices for Google Cloud data architectures, ensuring solutions are robust, compliant, and cost-effective.
 



 · Documentation: Produce detailed architectural documentation, data flow diagrams, and operational guides for implemented solutions.
 



 · Migration: Demonstrated experience in developing Data Migration-Modernization Solutions and To-Be Architectures, usage of Google Cloud RaMP (Rapid Migration Program) for multiple clients and industry verticals (e.g., BFSI, HCLS, TMEG, Retail) using Google Cloud native services/tools and ISV tools.
 



 · Commercials: Experience developing effort/cost estimates, service pricing, writing statements of work, and reviewing/contributing to client contractual agreements.
 



 · Ecosystem: Proven experience with the Google Cloud Partner ecosystem and enabling collaboration with Google Cloud SAs for the benefit of our organisation and customers.
 



  





 Keys to Success
 



 · Communication: Must have outstanding presentation and writing skills with the ability to communicate at all levels within the client and TEKsystems Global Services organization.
 



 · Business Acumen: Must have strong business and information technology acumen with the ability to communicate capabilities, gather and assess client requirements, and communicate solution and value proposition to clients.
 



 · Collaboration: Must have an ability to work effectively in agile and cross-functional internal teams, including Google Cloud Partner Ecosystem collaboration and ability to support the GTM strategy in region.
 



 · Credibility: Must have strong technical understanding with the ability to build credibility with IT and Business Leadership.
 



 · Experience: Must have 2-3 years' experience in developing Google Cloud Data Migration-Modernization practice.
 



 · Travel: Occasional travel will be required.

title: Management Consultant - Digital Strategy and IT Operating Model
description:
**About The Role**
 As a Management Consultant in Technology Strategy & IT Operations at KPMG, you will play a pivotal role in guiding our clients through their digital transformation journeys. You will leverage your expertise in digital strategy, IT operating models, and technology transformation to help clients achieve their business objectives. This role requires a deep understanding of digital technologies, strategic thinking, and the ability to contribute and lead complex projects.
   

  

 This role is open to candidates with a range of experience levels, from early-career professionals with 2-4 years of experience, ready to take the next step, to seasoned consultants with 6-10 years of experience, looking for a new challenge. Your impact, adaptability and growth mindset matter as much as your years in the field.
   

  

 Responsibilities will be adapted based on your experience. Junior team members will focus on delivery and learning, while senior professionals shall take on engagement or project leadership, solutioning or architectural responsibilities and provide mentoring.
   

  

 The role can be placed in Stockholm or Gothenburg, depending on your location and preference.
   

  

**Our Fields of Engagement**
* Digital Strategy Development: Collaborate with clients to develop comprehensive digital strategies that align with their business goals and objectives. This includes assessing current digital capabilities, identifying opportunities for improvement or developing futuristic roadmaps for digital transformation
* IT Operating Model Design: Design and implement future ready IT operating models that enhance efficiency, scalability and agility. This involves defining organization model, governance and steering model for IT, Business-IT Alignment, IT processes, Service delivery efficiency, performance KPIs and roles that complement client's digital strategy
* IT Strategic Sourcing: Analyze and optimize IT sourcing strategy, supplier landscape and IT spend to ensure value for money. This involves conducting cost-benefit analysis, benchmarking, reviewing supplier performance and identifying opportunities for cost savings. Additionally, support client with complex and strategic sourcing initiatives (RFx process)
* CIO advisory: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients Tech/IT leadership acting as a trusted advisor. Understand CxO business and IT challenges and provide tailored and optimal solutions, insights
* Thought Leadership: Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies. Contribute to thought leadership by presenting at conferences, and participating in industry forums and developing articles, point of views and surveys


 ,
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in information technology, Business Administration, or a related field
* 2-8 years of consulting experience in Digital/Technology strategy, IT Operating model, IT Service delivery and Steering Model transformation, cost transformation, or Technology transformation roles
* Experience from top-tier consulting firms or large enterprises is preferred
* Understanding of cloud strategy and cloud transformation, emerging technologies (AI, Gen & Agentic AI, Modern Data platforms) or IT infrastructure & IT operations
* Understanding of Enterprise Architecture concepts, Industry leading platforms across functions (e.g. ERP, CRM, CPQ, e-commerce, Supply chain & Logistics, Data Platforms)
* Contribute to developing client solution/proposals into the sales process
* Contribute to practice building initiatives and broader initiatives within advisory at KPMG
* Curious with attitude of continuous learning
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Proactive, entrepreneurial and collaborative mindset
* Excellent stakeholder management skills


**Why Join KPMG**
* Global Network: Be part of a global network of professionals and gain access to international projects and knowledge sharing
* Career Development: Benefit from continuous learning and development opportunities, including training courses, mentorship programs, and career progression pathways
* Inclusive Culture: Work in an inclusive and diverse environment where everyone's ideas and contributions are valued
* Impactful Work: Make a lasting, positive impact on clients and society through meaningful and challenging work


 At KPMG, we are committed to fostering a culture of integrity, excellence, and collaboration. We believe in empowering our people to make a positive impact on our clients, communities, and society. Our values guide our actions and help us achieve our vision of being the preferred insights-led professional services firm.
   

  

 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for digital transformation and a commitment to excellence, we invite you to join our team at KPMG and help us shape the future of our clients' businesses.
   

  

**Make a difference with us?**
 We welcome and look forward to receiving your application, if you have any questions, please contact Marie-Louise Bååth, marie-louise.baath@kpmg.se
